title: Primate Identification
description: From gorillas to lemurs, test your knowledge of our closest relatives in the animal kingdom

questions.question: Which great ape is the largest living primate, with males weighing up to 430 pounds?
Which primate is known for its distinctive red or orange hair and is found only on the islands of Borneo and Sumatra?
Which small primate has enormous eyes relative to its body size, is nocturnal, and can rotate its head nearly 180 degrees?
Which lemur species is known for its black and white striped tail and sunbathing behavior?
Which great ape species, closely related to chimpanzees, is known for resolving conflicts through social bonding rather than aggression?
Which small New World monkey has a distinctive golden mane and is critically endangered in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil?
Which primate from Borneo is famous for its unusually large, bulbous nose?
Which African primate has a brightly colored face with blue and red markings and is the largest monkey in the world?
Which ape is known as the 'acrobat of the rainforest' and moves through trees by swinging from branch to branch (brachiation)?
Which nocturnal primate from Madagascar has a long, bony middle finger used to extract insect larvae from tree bark?
Which New World monkey is known for its loud calls that can be heard up to three miles away through dense forest?
Which primate is the only ape found in both Africa and outside of Africa (in Asia)?
Which monkey species is commonly seen in Japanese hot springs during winter and is the most northerly-living non-human primate?
Which small primate from South America is one of the world's smallest monkeys, weighing only about 4 to 5 ounces?
On which island are lemurs found exclusively in the wild?
